definition: to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
"silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to have a taut face/to pull a long face/to look displeased
rectangular frame with a palm fiber mat woven across it (placed on a bed frame as the sleeping surface)
variant of 繃扒吊拷|绷扒吊拷[beng4 ba1 diao4 kao3]
to strip, tie up, hang and beat sb, an ancient torture technique

sentences.english: Bust 'em, and you'll bust five-and-thirty shillings.
sentences.chinese: 一繃破就繃掉了三十五個先令。

sentences.english: Then baste you so you won't get tough.
sentences.chinese: 然後繃你，你不會得到強硬。

sentences.english: His face was harsh and serious.
sentences.chinese: 他的臉繃得緊緊的，非常嚴肅。

sentences.english: The jacket is too tight and it's not comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 這件上衣太小了，繃在身上很不舒服。

sentences.english: She tacked the sleeve of the blouse into the armhole.
sentences.chinese: 她把罩衫的袖子繃在袖孔上。

sentences.english: Because his skin is so short that when he shut his eyes his mouth opens.
sentences.chinese: 由於他的皮膚繃得緊，眼皮一閉，嘴皮就要張開。

sentences.english: His skin was stretched drum-tight over his bony frame.
sentences.chinese: 皮膚緊巴巴地繃在骨架子上。

sentences.english: The muscles in her stomach rival Steve's and flex as she breathes.
sentences.chinese: 她的腹肌比的上斯蒂文，當她呼吸時腹肌就會繃起。

sentences.english: A guyed tower is designed to tilt slightly under extreme sea conditions.
sentences.chinese: 在惡劣海況下繃繩穩定塔被設計成稍微傾斜。

sentences.english: He crossed Townsend street, passed the frowning face of Bethel. El, yes: house of: Aleph, Beth. And past Nichols' the undertaker.
sentences.chinese: 他橫過湯森德街，打繃了面孔的伯特厄爾前面走過。

sentences.english: His back ached, and his shirt felt uncomfortably tight against his stomach.
sentences.chinese: 他的背疼痛，肚子部位的襯衫繃得很緊，怪不舒服的。

sentences.english: The glass has a crack in it.

definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain
lever-style guillotine/to chop using this type of guillotine
